Others: The article discusses the potential of ex-Yankee Kirby Yates rejoining the team as a free agent in the offseason to address their bullpen issues.
Yates has had a successful season with the Texas Rangers, posting a 1.37 ERA and 26 saves in 27 opportunities.
The article suggests that Yates may not re-sign with the Rangers and instead test the free agency market.
The Yankees are in need of bullpen assistance, and Yates could potentially be an upgrade from their current relievers.
